description:
## Welcome

This is a place to put general notes and extra information, for internal use.

To get started designing/documenting this API, select a version on the left. # Title
No Description

endpoints.name: GET_game_search
endpoints.description: Searches OpenCritic for games with similar names/titles. Search results are based on inverse trigram distance, with 0 being a perfect match and 1 being no shared/overlapping trigrams.

params.name: criteria
params.description: A requests parameter. Keyword of the game you want to search

endpoints._responses_yaml:
- execution results: list
	- execution results[0]: dict
		- id: str
		- name: str
		- dist: str

endpoints.name: GET_general_search
endpoints.description: Search a combination of Outlet, Game, and Author by String

params.name: criteria
params.description: A requests parameter. Keyword of the name you want to search.

endpoints._responses_yaml:
- execution results: list
	- execution results[0]: dict
		- id: str
		- name: str
		- dist: str
		- relation: str

params.name: criteria
params.description: A requests parameter. Name of an author

		- dist: str

response.name: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
response.description: The Witcher: Wild Hunt is a story-driven, next-generation open world role-playing game set in a visually stunning fantasy universe full of meaningful choices and impactful consequences. In The Witcher you play as the professional monster hunter, Geralt of Rivia, tasked with finding a child of prophecy in a vast open world rich with merchant cities, viking pirate islands, dangerous mountain passes, and forgotten caverns to explore.

trailers.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Launch Cinematic
trailers.description: "A Night to Remember", The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt launch cinematic, has arrived! Feast your eyes on a gripping portrayal what The ...
trailers.expectedName: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt — Launch Cinematic

trailers.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Official Gameplay Trailer
trailers.description: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Official Gameplay Trailer In The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt you become Geralt of Rivia, a monster slayer for hire. You take on the greatest contract of your life -- tracking...

trailers.description: Foreshadowing the story of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, The Trail Opening Cinematic is an epic sneak peek into the adventure that awaits gamers in Wild Hunt. See witchers Geralt of Rivia and his...
trailers.expectedName: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt — The Trail Opening Cinematic

trailers.description: CD Projekt RED is proud to present The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt "Killing Monsters" cinematic trailer to the public for the first time, offering a thrilling glimpse into the morally ambiguous universe...
trailers.expectedName: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt — Killing Monsters Cinematic

trailers.description: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Debut Gameplay gives you an exclusive sneak peek into the vast and gritty world of Geralt of Rivia, the witcher. Experience a realm where morality is not a simple...
trailers.expectedName: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt — Gameplay Trailer #1

params.name: platforms
params.description: A requests parameter. Platforms to search in a comma-separated list. Valid values are:all,ps4,xb1,pc,wii-u,vita,switch,oculus,vive,psvr,3ds,xbsx,ps5,stadia,vive

params.name: sort
params.description: A requests parameter. The choices are: score, data, name, num-reviews, precent-recommended, Do not include in request

params.name: order
params.description: A requests parameter. The choices are: asc, desc, Do not include in request

params.name: skip
params.description: A requests parameter. The number of records that should be skipped from the beginning of the dataset

endpoints.name: GET_reviews_for_game
endpoints.description: Gets reviews for a specific Game ID

response.snippet:
All told, I give the game a Buy in my Buy/Hold/Sell ranking. For all its flaws—and I realize that I've listed many—it is one of the most sprawling, magnificent solo RPGs ever made. It does too little to fix its mechanical problems, and focuses too much on creating an open world, but the quality of its quest design, world-building, and wonderful (if too large) cast of characters makes it a game that no RPG fan should miss.

It may be a flawed masterpiece, but it's a masterpiece nonetheless.

The Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt is a masterfully written rollercoaster, and though there is a lot to do in the game, I never felt overwhelmed by the Side Quests and optional tasks. CD Projekt Red has done a great job of bringing this saga to a close. The best part about all of this, however, is the fact that CD Projekt RED stayed true to its word. Every choice you make will determine how the story unfolds, and what the world becomes at the end of it all.

response.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt. Análisis para PS4, One y PCCloseIGN LogoCommentsCommentsCommentsComments
response.snippet: A unique experience that cannot be missed, becoming a must for lovers of role-playing and swashbuckling games. We will miss you, Geralt.

response.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Recensione - CHE STORIA! | IGN Italia
response.snippet: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt isn't perfect (yet?), but it's one of the best written RPG ever.

The upgraded edition takes what made the 2015 version so loved and throws it into the new generation with so much care that it feels like a different game while maintaining the backbone of the original. The improvements are executed flawlessly, and I can see myself pouring an additional 100 hours or more into this universe now that it can compare to other next-gen games.
response.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Next-Gen Update Review
The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt PS5 review | GodisaGeek.com
response.snippet: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt next-gen update makes a great game even better, improving practically every element of the much loved game.

It's a sprawling, ambitious, beautiful representation of a dark fantasy world, and games like this don't come along often. By no means perfect, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt still one of the year's biggest and best releases.
The Witcher 3 is vast, intriguing, and enthralling.

Playing The Witcher 3 with an eye for grand strategy can be both a densely engrossing and mechanically frustrating, overlong adventure. When played one move at a time, however, Wild Hunt is the supreme alchemical distillation of the role-playing experience. It's a bleakly human play at the heart of a dark fantasy.

Had it not been mired by bizarre lapses in design and a plethora of disturbing problems, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt would be almost bloody perfect. As it stands, CD Projekt Red has still put together something downright delicious. A truly great game that rises its head above its own hot water to proudly present a prosperous experience that only the most deliriously expectant could feel shortchanged by.

response.title: The Witcher 3 review PC
response.snippet: It's a flawed masterpiece, but make no mistake, it absolutely is a masterpiece – one of the best RPGs ever created, and a true tribute to Sapkowski's stories.
The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt on next-gen consoles is the best way to discover or re-discover one of the most celebrated RPGs of the last decade.
response.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Next-Gen Update Review

response.snippet: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt ends Geralt's tale in spectacular fashion, finding ways to fill a giant world with thrilling combat, beautiful sights, and a bevy of compelling content. A strong conclusion to The Witcher trilogy, and a masterpiece that will keep you enthralled for weeks and months to come.
'The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt' is far from perfect, but despite its flaws, Geralt's final adventure is 2015's strongest candidate for Game of the Year so far.

The story of Wild Hunt is a personal one, set in a huge and unrelentingly beautiful world. And moving through it in that way makes you feel like a part of it, rather than an honoured guest, all eyes swung expectantly towards you.
This vast fantasy adventure combines sophisticated storytelling with an expansive and richly conceived world

response.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt – Complete Edition Review – The Best Gets Better
response.snippet: There is no question that the free update makes The Witcher 3 Wild Hunt a better game. It looks better, it controls better and the many, minor improvements add up to a significantly improved experience. The Netflix-based DLC is not a cheap tie-in but a well-made and completely integrated new chapter worth playing. Short of an actual remake, the update brings a seven-year-old game within spitting distance of the best current-gen title. The Witcher 3 Wild Hunt update breathes new, exciting life into a genuine classic.

The core of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt remains unchanged, thank god. It's the same game we all fell in love with before. Playing on a PlayStation 5 and being able to play around with the new controls, including the haptic and adaptive triggers made playing as Geralt all the better. The new quick casting system works wonders for me, and if it doesn't for you then you retain the old configuration. The framerate has been given a noticeable overhaul as well. I no longer chugged about when I ran while in a city full of objects. This is the perfect excuse to play The Witcher 3 again. The best part of the update is that it's completely free; you can't afford not to play again.
response.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Next Gen Review - Gaming Nexus
The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Complete Edition Review (PS5) - Bringing A Classic To The Current Gen In Style - PlayStation Universe
response.snippet: Not everything is perfect in this current-gen upgrade, but the additions, new choices, and improvements make this version of the game feel complete. Despite the oddities that come with the new camera option, the presentation across the board just feels superb. It even lets those who missed the expansions jump right into that content from the jump. Such a great update to a beloved game comes free with the PS4 version, leaving this as almost a requirement for everyone who even remotely has an interest in playing it again or experiencing The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt for the first time.

params.name: id
params.description: A GET parameter. Game ID

params.name: skip
params.description: A requests parameter. Number of results.

params.name: sort
params.description: A requests parameter. Sorts reviews based on one of the following: newest (newest reviews first, by publishedDate of the review),oldest (oldest reviews first, by publishedDate of the review),score-high (highest scoring reviews first, with unscored reviews last),score-low (lowest scoring reviews first, with unscored reviews last),popularity (based on publication popularity),blend (reviews within the last 3.5 days first; otherwise, sort by popularity)

endpoints.name: GET_reviews_for_author
endpoints.description: Gets reviews for a specific Author ID

response.title: Trine 5: A Clockwork Conspiracy Review
response.snippet: Trine 5: A Clockwork Conspiracy sequel is a superb puzzle platformer that sticks close to the series’ playbook.

response.title: Blasphemous 2 Review
response.snippet: Blasphemous 2 is an orthodox Metroidvania with style, creepy bosses, and a gloriously gross return to Cvstodia.

response.title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre: The Game Review
response.snippet: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre's less asymmetrical take on the asymmetrical horror genre offers a few entertaining, technically challenged hours of fun.

response.title: Remnant 2 Review
response.snippet: Where Remnant: From The Ashes was a strong first draft, Remnant 2 is a revolutionary sequel and a sterling manifesto for the looter-shooter soulslike.

game.name: Testament: The Order of High Human

response.title: Testament: The Order of High Human Review
response.snippet: Testament: The Order of High Human is a bland, frustrating, and buggy fantasy adventure that would have been a bad four-hour Skyrim knockoff. At 40 hours, it’s hard to bear.

response.title: Everybody 1-2-Switch Review - IGN
response.snippet: Everybody 1-2-Switch is a paltry, unoriginal party game. Bringing it out is like inviting the fun police to bust up your shindig.

response.title: Dave The Diver Review
response.snippet: Dave The Diver is an aquatic adventure RPG that’s wholesome, wonderfully complex, and delightfully hard to put down.

response.title: Greyhill Incident Review
response.snippet: Greyhill Incident is a tedious horror game that mangles everything from its story to its stealth.
Diablo 4 is a stunning sequel with near perfect endgame and progression design that makes it absolutely excruciating to put down.

response.title: The Outlast Trials Early Access Review
response.snippet: The Outlast Trials is a unique cooperative horror game with a lot of potential, but it's one of those early access games that's unpolished and lacking content.

response.title: Dead Island 2 Review
response.snippet: Dead Island 2 is a hilarious gore-fest and a competent zombie-slaying adventure, but lacks creativity outside of its great sense of humor.

response.title: Meet Your Maker Review
response.snippet: Meet Your Maker is a great start for a dungeon-delving shooter that’s as unique as it is hard to put down.

response.title: Destiny 2: Lightfall Review
response.snippet: A couple exciting additions like Strand don't stop Destiny 2: Lightfall from feeling like a disappointing step backwards.

response.title: Hogwarts Legacy Review
response.snippet: In almost every way, Hogwarts Legacy is the Harry Potter RPG I’ve always wanted to play.

response.title: SpongeBob SquarePants: The Cosmic Shake Review
response.snippet: SpongeBob SquarePants: The Cosmic Shake is a barebones platformer that manages to be supremely boring despite its SpongeBob-infused charm.

response.title: High on Life Review
response.snippet: High on Life is a laugh-out-loud funny space odyssey that’s chaotic, bizarre, and a ton of fun.

response.title: Choo-Choo Charles Review
response.snippet: Choo-Choo Charles is a haphazardly assembled meme-come-to-life that’s short, silly, and exceedingly dull.

response.title: Goat Simulator 3 Review
response.snippet: Goat Simulator 3 is bigger, sillier, and packed with more low-stakes fun.

response.title: Sonic Frontiers Review
response.snippet: Sonic Frontiers is an ambitious open-world adventure that mostly succeeds at mixing up the Sonic formula, even when some of its ideas fall flat.

response.title: Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed Review
response.snippet: Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed is an asymmetrical multiplayer game that’s mostly enjoyable, but badly needs more content.

endpoints.name: GET_reviews_for_outlet
endpoints.description: Get reviews for a specific Outlet ID.

response.title: Tribes 3: Rivals Early Access Review
response.snippet: Tribes 3: Rivals is a rocket-powered sequel that packs some serious horsepower, but its current Early Access options run out of fuel quite quickly.

response.title: Backpack Battles Early Access Review
response.snippet: Backpack Battles’ satisfying inventory organizing mechanics make for an autobattler with a strong foundation, but its barebones Early Access launch leaves a lot of its potential waiting on the table.

response.title: Outcast: A New Beginning Review
response.snippet: Outcast: A New Beginning is an effective restart for this all-but-forgotten series. It's certainly rough around the edges, but outside of Just Cause you probably won't have more fun with movement in an open-world game than you will here.

response.title: Contra: Operation Galuga Review
response.snippet: Contra: Operation Galuga is an amusing run-and-gun that met my 2D shooting expectations, but rarely exceeded them.

response.title: Balatro Review
response.snippet: A deck-building poker roguelike of endlessly satisfying proportions, Balatro is the sort of fun that threatens to derail whole weekend plans.

response.title: Nightingale Early Access Review
response.snippet: Nightingale has a cool setting and some fun ideas at its Early Access launch, but right now its compelling survival-crafting progression is bogged down by frustrating pacing and an underserved story.

response.title: Unicorn Overlord Review
response.snippet: Unicorn Overlord is a visual delight that's brimming with creativity, and an absolute must-play for any fan of strategy RPGs.

response.title: Expeditions: A MudRunner Game Review
response.snippet: Expeditions: A MudRunner Game isn’t a replacement for the supremely addictive SnowRunner, but its more untamed wilderness maps make it a worthwhile complementary experience.

response.title: The Thaumaturge Review
response.snippet: The Thaumaturge is a slow, text heavy caper that is often curious and sometimes captivating, weaving revolutionary labor politics and mysticism together to create a unique and charming piece of historical science fiction.

response.title: The Outlast Trials Review
response.snippet: The Outlast Trials is a bloody cooperative horror game that burns brightly, but fizzles after a few enjoyable hours.

response.title: WWE 2K24 Review
response.snippet: While not drastically different, WWE 2K24 is better in almost every way, touting small but smart additions to well-tested systems and modes as opposed to taking bigger risks.

response.title: Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance Review
response.snippet: Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance may look the part, but the obnoxious mission design and confused campaign structure of this RTS just aren't worth your time.

response.title: Splatoon 3: Side Order DLC Review
response.snippet: A few fishy elements aside, Splatoon 3’s Side Order DLC is a delectable roguelite expansion with outstanding original enemies and crazy new abilities.

response.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth Review
response.snippet: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth impressively builds off of what Remake set in motion, both as a best-in-class action-RPG full of exciting challenges and an awe-inspiring recreation of a world that has meant so much to so many for so long.

response.title: Last Epoch Review
response.snippet: Push past its one-note campaign and Last Epoch is an impressive, time-bending action RPG that combines rich customization with modern action.

response.title: Pacific Drive Review
response.snippet: Balancing Pacific Drive’s scrappy systems can be punishing, but the riveting tension of each drive through its unnerving world was always enough to keep my hands placed firmly on the wheel.

response.title: Foamstars Review
response.snippet: Foamstars' combat mechanics are unexpectedly engaging, but confounding time-gated modes and aggressive monetization make them harder to enjoy.

response.title: Skull and Bones Review
response.snippet: Skull and Bones is a maritime RPG with a strong foundation, even if it feels like a live-service first draft.

response.title: Helldivers 2 Review
response.snippet: Helldivers 2's combat feels fantastic, its missions stay fresh and interesting, and its smart progression system doesn’t nickel and dime you.

response.title: Mario vs. Donkey Kong Review
response.snippet: Mario vs. Donkey Kong might not be as polished as a Mini-Mario toy fresh off the assembly line, but it's just as full of charm and fun to play with.

params.name: id
params.description: A GET parameter. Game ID

params.name: skip
params.description: A requests parameter. Number of results.

params.name: sort
params.description: A requests parameter. Sorts reviews based on one of the following: newest (newest reviews first, by publishedDate of the review),oldest (oldest reviews first, by publishedDate of the review),score-high (highest scoring reviews first, with unscored reviews last),score-low (lowest scoring reviews first, with unscored reviews last),popularity (based on publication popularity),blend (reviews within the last 3.5 days first; otherwise, sort by popularity)
